snippet.title: The Bogeymen: who's coming to get your team in round 20?
snippet.content:
WHO PULLS out the stops when they play against your club? Here are the round 20 bogeymen, determined with help from the :
Geelong v Sydney
Joel Selwood
The skipper was one of few who excelled in last year's preliminary final loss for the Cats, with 32 disposals and four score assists.
Rating: 10
Isaac Heeney
The talented Swan starred last time these sides met, with 28 disposals, six clearances and a goal.
Rating: 51 Greater Western Sydney v Melbourne
Phil Davis
The reliable Giant excelled in the season-opening loss against the Demons last year, picking up 15 disposals and 14 intercept possessions.
Rating: 195
Tom McDonald
The versatile Dee played well last time these teams met, when he had 22 disposals and eight marks.
Rating: 37 Essendon v Carlton
Anthony McDonald-Tipungwuti
The hard-hitting Bomber has played better against the Blues than any other side. In last season's final-round win, he booted four goals.
Rating: 102
Marc Murphy
The Carlton captain is ranked No. 4 in the competition against Essendon since 2010, behind Gary Ablett, Lance Franklin and Patrick Dangerfield.
Rating: 183 Brisbane Lions v Western Bulldogs
Dayne Zorko
The zippy Lion finished with 32 disposals, 10 score involvements and two goals in the round five loss to the Dogs.
Rating: 5
Jack Macrae
The hard-running Bulldog collected 29 disposals and 10 score involvements last time these sides met.
Rating: 119 North Melbourne v Collingwood
Taylor Adams
The ball-winning midfielder is coming off the finest match of his career, when he notched up 34 disposals and eight clearances in the draw with Adelaide.
Rating: 28
Ben Brown
The Roos' cult hero is in superb form, having slotted 17.5 in the past month.
Rating: 122 Fremantle v Gold Coast
Nat Fyfe
The 2015 Brownlow medallist plays better against the Suns than anyone else in the competition. In last season's round two loss, he won 34 disposals and 10 clearances.
Rating: 65
Tom Lynch
The Suns' co-captain was on fire in round 18 win last year, taking five contested marks, bagging four goals and handing off three score assists as Gold Coast toppled the Dockers.
Rating: 43 St Kilda v West Coast
Seb Ross
The improved Saint was his side's best in the round two loss to the Eagles. He picked up 29 disposals and nine score involvements.
Rating: 39
Jeremy McGovern
The intercept marking specialist performs better against the Saints than any other side. Last time these clubs met, he had 20 disposals and nine marks.
Rating: 42 Richmond v Hawthorn
Dustin Martin
The Brownlow favourite was his side's best in the round 18 loss last season, racking up 39 disposals and 10 clearances.
Rating: 3
Ben McEvoy
The in-form ruckman had a career-best game against the Tigers in the round six, 2014 win. He notched up 22 disposals, six clearances, six tackles and six hit-outs to advantage.
Rating: 57 Adelaide v Port Adelaide
Rory Sloane
The tough Crow won 31 disposals and eight clearances in the round three Showdown victory.
Rating: 6
Ollie Wines
The big-bodied onballer was his side's best when these teams met earlier this season, finishing with 30 disposals and nine inside-50s.
Rating: 46
â€¢
